column4: Does anyone know where I can find detailed information about the differences in the sysvinit system for service start/stop/restart between Fedora and Ubuntu?
I had Xvfb running as a service in Fedora, jsut switched to Ubunut Jaunty and now I'm getting grief
can we see your fedora init script?
and does sudo /etc/init.d/xfvb start work? Or how about sudo service xfvb start?
please keep it in the main channel :)
ah yes that not the nice way of stopping and starting xvfb. Try do sudo service start xfvb
sorry, is an init script for xvfb not provided?
sorry, I'm not really familiar with xvfb
so then using your init script whatever start should work right?
do it with sudo prepended then
not unless you specify them to
even if the script owner is root
you might want to add a bit to the top that checks if you are using sudo/are root and warns if you aren't
